net.java.jddac.common.util
Class ArgStore

java.lang.Object
  net.java.jddac.common.fblock.Entity
      net.java.jddac.common.util.ArgStore
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConfigurationInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
ArgStoreFileJ2me, ArgStoreJ2me, ArgStoreJ2se
public abstract class ArgStore
extends Entity

Stores objects of type Vector and ArgArray into persistent storage. Since the platform storage api is different on J2ME and J2SE this class acts as a factory class using the getInstance method to create the appropriate instance. Instances of ArgStore cannot be created using new as ArgStore itself is an abstract class. When getInstance is invoked the method will instantiate either a J2SE version or a J2ME version depending on the current platform.

Method Detail

setClassFactory

public static void setClassFactory(java.lang.Class argStoreFactory)
Set the specific class factory to be used when creating new instances. If the argStoreFactory is not provided then the system will attempt to load ArgStoreJ2me or ArgStoreJ2se.

Parameters:
argStoreFactory - - the class instance to use for the factory.

getInstance

public static ArgStore getInstance()
Create an instance of ArgStore. Instances of ArgStore cannot be created using new as ArgStore itself is an abstract class. When getInstance is invoked the method will instantiate either a J2SE version or a J2ME version depending on the current platform.

Returns:
- an ArgStore instance.

getInstance

public static ArgStore getInstance(ArgArray config)
Create an instance of ArgStore with specified ArgStore factory and coder. Instances of ArgStore cannot be created using new as ArgStore itself is an abstract class. When getInstance is invoked the method will instantiate an instance as specified by the ArgStore.argStoreBlockname config element. A coder can additionally be specified using the ArgStore.argStoreBlockname element. Additonal coder or ArgStore properties can be included in the configuration ArgArray.

Returns:
- an ArgStore instance.
